programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: From Hornby to Triang and beyond, this documentary explores how the British have been in love with model railways for more than a century.

programme.title: Some Like It Hot
programme.desc: Joe and Jerry are two innocent musicians who accidentally witness a gangland murder. To get out of town in a hurry and be paid for it, they disguise themselves as women, and join an all-girl band travelling to Florida. All seems to be going well until Joe, as Josephine, starts to fall for Sugar Kane, the band's singer, and Jerry, as Daphne, elicits more interest than he'd like from millionaire Osgood Fielding III.

programme.title: Arena
programme.desc: Director Billy Wilder discusses his career with German film-maker Volker Schlöndorff.

programme.title: Pride & Prejudice
programme.desc: When Elizabeth Bennet meets the wealthy and eligible Mr Darcy, she is at first put off by his proud manner and his disdain for the ill-judged behaviour of her mother and younger sisters. The growing attraction between them, however, will cause both Elizabeth and Darcy to reassess their initial impressions as they discover each other's true character.

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.desc: From Hornby to Triang and beyond, this documentary explores how the British have been in love with model railways for more than a century.

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: Scientists have started looking to the heavens and wondering what the weather might be like on other planets. We are witnessing the birth of extra-terrestrial meteorology, as technology is allowing astronomers to study other planets like never before.

programme.title: Timewatch
programme.desc: Documentary drama exploring the last days of Napoleon's life in exile on the island of St Helena. To the British, Napoleon has always been an ogre - an enemy, a foreign despot - but he is also remembered as a man of incredible energy, who laid the foundations of the modern French state. In exile on St Helena, he fought his last battle with words, turning defeat at Waterloo to his advantage, presenting himself as the rescuer of France and a man who hated war.

programme.title: Inside The Saudi Sporting Machine
programme.desc: BBC Sports Editor Dan Roan travels to Jeddah and Riyadh for a rare insight into Saudi Arabia's game-changing sporting investments. Speaking to some of the key figures involved, he asks what lies behind the country's strategy, and what issues it raises for the world of sport.

programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: 100 Women
programme.desc: Clara, Liszy and Paty are breaking gender barriers in the male-dominated cargo transport industry - they are some of Mexico's traileras, women truck drivers travelling long distances on the country's dangerous routes. Robberies and abuse are part of the hazards they face in the job - but the traileras are determined to overcome adversity. BBC 100 Women rides with them as they work to make a better life for their families and change the face of the next generation of drivers in Latin America.

programme.title: The Travel Show

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Talking Movies
programme.desc: The team looks back at highlights in cinema in 2023, including the global success of Barbie and Oppenheimer. The simultaneous release of those two dissimilar films chasing very different audiences, which became known as Barbenheimer, was one of the biggest movie events of the year. Also creating headlines in 2023 was the months-long strike by actors and writers in Hollywood - the team hears from one actor who was out on the picket lines.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The BBC's Breakfast programme features the latest news, sport, business, weather and other items on a daily basis.

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Join Gethin Jones, Kym Marsh, Sara Cox, Kimberley Walsh, Sam Quek, Rav Wilding and their family of experts for conversation, advice and great company.

programme.title: For Love or Money
programme.desc: Pat Holt was separated and looking for a companion to go on holiday with. When she met Tim Hall online, he seemed like the perfect gentleman. But when Tim's business trip to India ran into difficulties, he asked Pat for financial support, and now she is £50,000 worse off and wants to know who is really behind the man calling himself Tim. Ann Larkin made an unlikely friend on an online photography group, but the sum she lost to him is truly eye watering.

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: A young couple's business is threatened when their online account is hacked into and they face blackmail demands. They're not alone as many small businesses are affected by incidents like this. But specialist cybercrime police teams are closing in on the criminals behind this growing online threat.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel is in south Wales, looking around a multi-apartment auction lot. Martin is in the jungle, making his way through years of neglect in a two-bedroom mid-terrace on Merseyside. And Dion is tickled pink by a retro feature he finds in Birmingham.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Join Christina Trevanion and experts Kate Bliss and Richard Madley as they go antique hunting in Oswestry, Shropshire, before heading to Stratford-upon-Avon for today's auction. Christina discovers how a collector of old bottles can tell the history of this Shropshire market town through his collection.

programme.title: BBC News at One
programme.desc: The latest national and international news, followed by weather.

programme.title: BBC London News
programme.desc: News, sport and weather from London.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: The lives of those who work in and visit a doctor's practice in Letherbridge, Midlands. There, the doctors practice the profession with passion and also have to deal with the problems of their families.

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presides as sellers come face to face with five dealers who battle it out to make the highest bid.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah scours Hampshire's property market to find somewhere for a couple who are temporarily relying on the goodwill of family. They have a £600k budget and want a country home close to the coast. Sticking with a maritime theme, Sonali also gets behind the scenes at the Mary Rose Museum with the treasures uncovered when King Henry VIII's warship was raised after four centuries on the seabed.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts travel across the nation to search for hidden treasures, from household items to one-of-a kind collectibles. The experts then head to auction to battle it out and make the biggest profit from their items.

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Louise has been studying stone carving for two years, and now she needs to make it pay. Jennifer creates beautiful textile designs, but needs to find her direction.

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: A twist on the classic quiz show formula, contestants search through the depths of their knowledge in an attempt to score as few points as possible.

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Follow the latest dramas of the residents of Albert Square in London's East End as they deal with life, love and loss.

programme.title: Stacey Solomon's Crafty Christmas
programme.desc: Stacey Solomon returns with a Christmas special where friends and family join her to create ingenious, homemade gifts and decorations that she hopes will bring joy and wonder without blowing the budget. This year, she'll be throwing a special Christmas party to say thank you to the volunteers who have been working throughout the year to help those in need. With five kids to keep occupied, and Jo leaving for a work trip, Stacey will need all of the help she can get.

programme.title: Gavin and Stacey
programme.desc: It's been ten years since we last went to Billericay to spend Christmas with the Shipmans and the Wests.This year we're off to Wales for the festivities, where Bryn's cooking dinner for over thirteen people.

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Features a studio audience quizzing top politicians on the events of the day. The panel surrounding presenter Fiona Bruce is composed of at least one member of the three major parties.

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: Weekly political chat with Laura Kuenssberg, Adam Fleming, Katya Adler and Chris Mason.

programme.title: The Christmas Break
programme.desc: Jack and Caroline face a significant crossroad in their relationship: Jack wants children, Caroline doesn't. They travel to Ireland for Christmas and must confront their own marital issues while staying with their large, chaotic extended family.

programme.title: Survivor
programme.desc: With just six people left, the end is in sight. But who's burnt all their bridges? Who will be the 13th person voted out of Survivor?

programme.title: The Weakest Link
programme.desc: Romesh Ranganathan takes to the podium to host one of the world's most iconic quizzes. Eight celebrities hope to show off their general knowledge and bank as much money as possible for charity, before voting off The Weakest Link each round. After a final head-to-head, one player will be crowned the strongest link and take the prize. Celebrity contestants in this episode are Kimberly Wyatt, Ellie Taylor, Rhys James, Sinitta, Darren Harriott, Gregg Wallace, Hannah Byczkowski and Lesley Garrett.

programme.title: Joins BBC News

programme.title: For Love or Money
programme.desc: Norman met Michael via a dating site. After getting to know each other, Michael told Norman he was in line for a big inheritance but needed Norman's financial support to access it. Now Norman wants to find out if Michael is the real deal, and Kym and Ashley are helping him get to the truth. Meanwhile, DC Mason is tracking a suspected romance fraudster right here in the UK and is about to pounce with an early-morning raid.

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: A train driver suffers facial injuries after a brick is hurled at his cab, shattering the window. The train's travelling at 70mph but can the driver bring it safely to a standstill, despite his injuries? A rise in the number of incidents like this has prompted one train company to start installing on-board technology aimed at making journeys safer for passengers and staff.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin is buoyed by a bijou bungalow near Bradford, West Yorkshire, before heading down to Ramsgate on the Kent coast to meet a couple who have found their dream forever home. Dion finds a quirky house in Oldbury, near Birmingham, that just keeps on giving.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian celebrates the eclectic and nostalgic world of collecting in a special episode of the programme. He picks out some of the most popular names in collectibles, from silver and ceramics to glassware and mid-century toys, and shares his insider tips to help you spot the best bargains. Joining him is Craig Glenday, editor-in-chief of Guinness World Records, to discuss some of the world's biggest and wackiest collections.

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Somerset is the destination today, where Alistair Appleton is helping an industrious young couple from Hertfordshire who are eager to make a rural move to the county.

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Antiques experts travel across the nation to search for hidden treasures, from household items to one-of-a kind collectibles. The experts then head to auction to battle it out and make the biggest profit from their items.

programme.desc: Harrison dreams of a successful furniture-making business, but can he create a signature style? And can Rachel sell enough wearable cake shoes to give up her corporate career?

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: A special stand-up comedy edition of the general knowledge quiz in which four teams try to come up with the answers that no-one else could think of. programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie asks the questions in another episode of the classic quiz, where celebrities donate to their chosen charities. Hollyoaks actor Nick Pickard, former goalkeeper for the Lionesses Karen Bardsley, DJ and radio presenter Harpz Kaur and broadcaster Terry Christian are in the famous black chair tonight answering questions on Star Trek: The Next Generation, The Films of Will Ferrell, Diljit Dosanjh, and Manchester United - the Tommy Docherty Years.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon is back in the host's chair for a festive edition of the comedy panel show, with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack. Celebrity guests Gloria Hunniford, Guz Khan, Christopher Eccleston and Sophie Willan reveal amazing stories about themselves.

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: It's Christmas at Button House and Mike and Alison are heading to Mike's parents to celebrate with family. As Mike piles up the Tupperware with what he insists are only side dishes, despite one clearly being an entire turkey, Kitty expresses her disappointment at not spending Christmas day with Alison. Alison promises that they'll be back by the evening and what's more, reveals to the ghosts that there is a Christmas surprise for each of them in the library.

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Kirsty Young is host, with guest panellists writer and director Armando Iannucci and comedian Phil Wang joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news.

programme.title: Two Doors Down
programme.desc: It's Father's Day at the Carvery for Ian, Gordon, their parents, and Christine, who wangled an invitation. As she grumps about the beef, Gordon is grappling with family revelations.

With music from Gregory Porter, who performs Christmas Wish.

programme.desc: The team looks back at highlights in cinema in 2023, including the global success of Barbie and Oppenheimer. The simultaneous release of those two dissimilar films chasing very different audiences, which became known as Barbenheimer, was one of the biggest movie events of the year. Also creating headlines in 2023 was the months-long strike by actors and writers in Hollywood - the team hears from one actor who was out on the picket lines.

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: The BBC's Breakfast programme features the latest news, sport, business, weather and other items on a daily basis.

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Join Gethin Jones, Kym Marsh, Sara Cox, Kimberley Walsh, Sam Quek, Rav Wilding and their family of experts for conversation, advice and great company.

programme.title: For Love or Money
programme.desc: Pat Holt was separated and looking for a companion to go on holiday with. When she met Tim Hall online, he seemed like the perfect gentleman. But when Tim's business trip to India ran into difficulties, he asked Pat for financial support, and now she is £50,000 worse off and wants to know who is really behind the man calling himself Tim. Ann Larkin made an unlikely friend on an online photography group, but the sum she lost to him is truly eye watering.

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: A young couple's business is threatened when their online account is hacked into and they face blackmail demands. They're not alone as many small businesses are affected by incidents like this. But specialist cybercrime police teams are closing in on the criminals behind this growing online threat.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel is in south Wales, looking around a multi-apartment auction lot. Martin is in the jungle, making his way through years of neglect in a two-bedroom mid-terrace on Merseyside. And Dion is tickled pink by a retro feature he finds in Birmingham.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Join Christina Trevanion and experts Kate Bliss and Richard Madley as they go antique hunting in Oswestry, Shropshire, before heading to Stratford-upon-Avon for today's auction. Christina discovers how a collector of old bottles can tell the history of this Shropshire market town through his collection.

programme.title: The Bidding Room

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Sonali Shah scours Hampshire's property market to find somewhere for a couple who are temporarily relying on the goodwill of family. They have a £600k budget and want a country home close to the coast. Sticking with a maritime theme, Sonali also gets behind the scenes at the Mary Rose Museum with the treasures uncovered when King Henry VIII's warship was raised after four centuries on the seabed.

With five kids to keep occupied, and Jo leaving for a work trip, Stacey will need all of the help she can get.

After a final head-to-head, one player will be crowned the strongest link and take the prize. Now Norman wants to find out if Michael is the real deal, and Kym and Ashley are helping him get to the truth. Meanwhile, DC Mason is tracking a suspected romance fraudster right here in the UK and is about to pounce with an early-morning raid.

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: A train driver suffers facial injuries after a brick is hurled at his cab, shattering the window. The train's travelling at 70mph but can the driver bring it safely to a standstill, despite his injuries? A rise in the number of incidents like this has prompted one train company to start installing on-board technology aimed at making journeys safer for passengers and staff.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin is buoyed by a bijou bungalow near Bradford, West Yorkshire, before heading down to Ramsgate on the Kent coast to meet a couple who have found their dream forever home. Dion finds a quirky house in Oldbury, near Birmingham, that just keeps on giving.

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian celebrates the eclectic and nostalgic world of collecting in a special episode of the programme. He picks out some of the most popular names in collectibles, from silver and ceramics to glassware and mid-century toys, and shares his insider tips to help you spot the best bargains. Joining him is Craig Glenday, editor-in-chief of Guinness World Records, to discuss some of the world's biggest and wackiest collections.

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: It's Christmas at Button House and Mike and Alison are heading to Mike's parents to celebrate with family. Alison promises that they'll be back by the evening and what's more, reveals to the ghosts that there is a Christmas surprise for each of them in the library.

He's performed here hundreds of times but never gets a chance to enjoy all this seaside town has to offer.

After starting the next day with an outdoor group meditation session amongst the wild monkeys and spectacular views, Duncan and John waste no time exploring the bustling town of Rishikesh.

programme.desc: Stevie Smith challenges Boy in the mini-golf tournament. However, as they practice, they actually become fast friends and neglect their training to hang out. When the contest arrives, it is revealed Stevie was only pretending to be Boy's friend.

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Sick of being overlooked by the family because of his small size, Mouse builds an invention to make him grow. But he keeps getting larger, and the bigger he gets, the more unintentionally destructive he becomes.

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: A massive Beanostalk sprouts up in Beanotown, taking all the gang's Christmas stuff, and Gnasher, up beyond the clouds to a land of giants! Dennis and the Gang bravely climb up to Ginormotown, determined to find Gnasher and bring Christmas back home. On their journey they find themselves giving away all their christmas goodies, showing the Ginormotowners, and themselves what the spirit of Christmas is really about!

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: A patch of wet cement, a boy and a dog itching to put their prints into it and a policeman determined not to let that happen. Can Dennis and Gnasher muddle Sergeant Slipper long enough before the cement sets?

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy wakes up after a nap, starving, but the last jar of Yummy chocolate spread is empty. Grizzy has the idea of mixing chocolate powder with coconut milk. The Lemmings, who are every bit as gluttonous, want their share of the choco-coco drink.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy gets a bite on the end of his fishing line but the Lemmings decide to divert it in the hope of a tow for their kite.

programme.title: Summer Camp Island
programme.desc: Faced with two potential husbands, burly Harry and sensitive Barry, Barb enlists Hedgehog and Oscar to help her weigh her options.

programme.title: Horrible Histories

programme.title: Jamie Johnson FC

programme.title: OOglies

programme.title: The Zoo
programme.desc: A countdown of the top 10 clips selected by the narrator and unenthusiastically assisted by Woody the baboon. Highlights include Geoffrey the gorilla's 'nose-flute' masterpiece, birthday cakes being eaten and rapping reptiles.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: A submarine is trapped in an astonishing location! The Nektons launch an elaborate and dangerous rescue mission to save the people inside. Could it be their missing grandparents?

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: Playtime is over as Danger Mouse battles an army of vengeful soft toys. Pink Dawn's henchman-teddy bear, Snuggles, is bringing cuddly toys to life as rage-filled criminals. Danger Mouse spots the source of Snuggles power, it's Pink Dawn's tiara.

programme.title: Ninja Express
programme.desc: A school girl orders a wish-granting vase so she doesn't have to go to school, but the Ninjas must face a series of tests set by the vase's guardian in order to get it.

programme.title: Taffy
programme.desc: A skunk sneaks into the manor and the pets join forces to get rid of the intruder.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: When Grizzy goes fishing, the Lemmings jump on the opportunity to transform the cabin into a giant ice slide. Upon his return, the bear puts an end to the rodents' bobsleigh party and gets ready to savour his day's catch.

programme.title: Grizzy and The Lemmings
programme.desc: Grizzy steals a magic statue that has the power to make objects appear in real life.

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese

programme.title: Odd Squad

programme.title: The Boss Baby

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Nicky are sleeping over at Sula's house, but Bing has forgotten Hoppity. The wind causes a branch to make a scratchy noise that terrifies Bing, who isn't very comforted by Sula's fairy rhino. Amma phones Flop, while Sula, Nicky and Bing play 'Nicky tickles' as they wait. Flop arrives, bringing his sleeping bag and Hoppity so they can all sleep over.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Green stages a magic show to introduce her new friends Black and White. Learn the difference between light, bright and dark colours with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Hey Duggee

programme.desc: It's a very windy day and the Squirrels want to play outside. Duggee knows what to do, he's flying his kite. The Squirrels make their own kites to fly.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey teaches Bingo how to use magic so she can make Mum play with her, but she forgets to explain the most important rule: never use magic for cheekiness.

programme.title: Bluey

programme.title: Love Monster

programme.title: Something Special: We're All Friends

The What's in the Box? game reveals a wooden world toy, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that follow the theme of around the world.

programme.desc: Kiwa is embarrassed to visit Dr Ranj because it hurts when she wees. Dr Ranj explains that it is nothing to be embarrassed about, but it might hurt because she has an infection. He does an ultrasound scan to check her bladder and kidneys.

The Go Jetters are also visiting London while Lars helps to fix his favourite his bridge - Tower Bridge. Ubercorn explains that this amazing bridge can be raised to allow tall river traffic to pass safely beneath.

Evil Pea arrives with the Cobs, who are rowing in great sync. Evil Pea says they're going to beat Supertato in the race, and they row away leaving Supertato's boat behind.

programme.desc: Duggee is having a cup of tea in his favourite cup when Roly surprises him with a very loud PEEK-A-BOO! It is so loud that Duggee jumps and drops his cup which shatters into pieces. Time for a bit of pottery.

programme.desc: Dad tries to teach Bluey how to play chess, but Mum thinks she is still too young. When Bingo joins in, the kids make up their own rules, but they still can't beat Dad.

programme.desc: Bluey gets a new teddy for Christmas and introduces him to the whole family, but the family plays too rough with him and now he wants to go home.

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: It's time to colour Christmas. In this special song episode, Red and Green colour in all things related to Christmas with the help of the other Colourblocks. From a snowman to a Christmas tree and the mighty brussels sprouts, the Colourblocks eventually create a very colourful Christmas for all to enjoy.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos find themselves in an office watching a very bored man entertain himself by joining up some paperclips. When he's gone, Great BigHoo empties the whole box of paperclips on to the desk and starts joining them up too.

programme.title: Something Special: We're All Friends
programme.desc: Justin and his friends go on a roarsome adventure to a dinosaur park, while Mr Tumble visits Shopkeeper Tumble in `The Shop with the Lot' to buy Tumble Ted a birthday present.

programme.title: My Petsaurus
programme.desc: Topsy guards the house from all the early morning deliveries, but all the barking makes it very difficult for Chloe to finish her book.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Tinky Winky, Dipsy, Laa-­-Laa and Po drive to the Hidey Hup in the Tubby Car. The Teletubbies have fun getting dizzy on the Tubby Spinny.

programme.title: The Toddler Club at Home
programme.desc: Gemma, Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear welcome toddlers Dylan, Luna and Isaac, and their grown-ups to the Toddler Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too. The What's in the Box? game reveals a wooden toy dinosaur, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are all about dinosaurs. This theme is explored through exploration, play, song and story.

programme.title: Tiny Wonders
programme.desc: The Noggle is landing, there must be a Tiny Wonder to explore. The Nogglins land in a garden and discover a race track. Fidd wants to win, but which way is the fastest?

programme.title: Olga da Polga
programme.desc: After a chat with Noel, Olga thinks its Karen's birthday. But it turns out that the celebration is for Olga. She's been with the Sawdusts for one whole year!

programme.title: Gecko's Garage
programme.desc: Baby Truck is back at the garage! She's been playing in muddy puddles and needs a clean, so it's up to Gecko and the Mechanicals to clean her up with their car wash machine.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bluey sends a video to Bingo in hospital to show her that everyone gets sick sometimes.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato is out chasing a milkshake robot and leaves Broccoli in charge of Tato Tower. Evil Pea tries to take over the tower, but Broccoli puts on a great defence.

programme.title: Let's Go for a Walk
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers walk through a forest to the beach in order to draw pictures in the sand. On the way, they find a big rock, copy a pigeon having a drink, make patterns in the water and even spot a tree that looks like a spider.

programme.title: Nick Cope's Popcast
programme.desc: The star has disappeared from the Christmas tree. Does the little elf know where it is?

programme.title: Ferne and Rory's Teeny Tiny Creatures
programme.desc: Freddie finds out all about creatures that live on land and underwater - newts. Chantelle is at a zoo to meet Kira and two very special salamanders while Rory and his son Sandy are at a country park to meet a very special protected newt.

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Henry and his little sister Sophie make crowns and become King Henry and Queen Sophie. Along with their noble knights, Mummy and Mama, they head to the local park on a royal quest to rescue their toy turtle Pebbles, who is trapped in a castle.

programme.title: Big Cook Little Cook
programme.desc: Jen makes a rain stick using rice, and Small wants one too. Isaac the inventor visits the cafe, Small flies off to find out how popcorn is made, and the chefs cook up cheesy corn clouds for their clever guest.

programme.title: Waffle the Wonder Dog
programme.desc: Waffle discovers he has a talent for painting Mrs Hobbs's cat, George, and decides to share his work with her as a way to get in her good books.

programme.title: Get Well Soon Hospital
programme.desc: Riz has come to see Dr Ranj wearing his cycle helmet because he is worried about falling down. Dr Ranj tells Riz he's going to do a test called an electroencephalogram, or EEG for short.

programme.title: Andy's Safari Adventures
programme.desc: When Jen notices a herd of Asian elephants are caught in a flood in Bangladesh, it's up to Andy to help them. Jetting off in his safari mobile, Andy heads to Bangladesh and, in a race against time, helps the elephants reach higher ground.

programme.title: Yakka Dee
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say `monkey' and we go on a whirlwind word adventure. We see lots of different monkeys! We see a furry monkey, a mini monkey, a jumping monkey and a swinging monkey.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Rocket Ten and friends blast off into space for a rhyming adventure to visit planets 11 to 20. Explore numbers 11 to 20 with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: K can kick but C can't, so it's word-magic-for-goalposts and a kid keeping score. Then they team up for CK vs The Sock, and they just need that magic touch.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: A big box of bits and pieces is delivered to the Clubhouse and the Squirrels are very excited. Duggee and the Squirrels will have to work very hard to put it all together, so it's time for a bit of teamwork.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: When it doesn't snow on Unicorn Day, Love Monster uses snow bubbles to cover Fluffytown with snow so Glitterhorn can deliver their presents, but he accidentally snows everyone in!

programme.title: Colourblocks
programme.desc: Black and White colour a city with new the help of new friend Grey. Learn to mix different shades of grey with the Colourblocks.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: It's Christmas Eve and the Tumble Family are desperately trying to get everything ready for Christmas Day. In true Tumble fashion, chaos ensues.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: Laa-­-Laa shows Tinky Winky how to play crazy golf. Tinky Winky loves hitting the ball which travels up and down the hills of Teletubbyland and into the Tiddlytubbies.

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: The adventures of ten friends in Numberland who can always count on each other. Each friend has a different ability that helps them on their adventures.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Evil Pea thinks the Veggies won't like it when she covers the supermarket in ice, but instead they have the best snow day ever, so she creates a giant snowball to ruin their fun.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Glitch is excited when Lars refits the Grimbler with new, clean biogas boosters that could make it even faster than the Vroomster! The boosters run on gas made from food waste, and luckily there is plenty of leftover food in the academy canteen for the Grimbots to gather up. But Glitch overloads the boosters and BOOM! He loses control of the Grimbler and is sent flying across the academy, out of control.

programme.title: Maddie's Do You Know?
programme.desc: Maddie visits an electric car factory to find out how an electric car works. She learns that an electric car uses batteries and electricity to make the energy it needs to move. Using her special cameras, she shows us how these cars use.

programme.title: Andy's Safari Adventures
programme.desc: When Jen accidentally destroys a video of an Arctic fox, Andy takes to the skies in his safari-mobile and heads to the Arctic to re-record the action on his gizmo. But a hungry polar bear and a snowstorm thwart his every move. Can Andy record a new video of the Arctic fox before Mr Hammond notices the old one was destroyed?

programme.title: Our Family
programme.desc: Kyra and Khloe visit a farm where they meet two beautiful ponies. After a quick grooming, they get to take their new friends out for a ride.

programme.title: Ranger Hamza's Eco Quest
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers discover how owls play an important role in the environment. They find out that they are amazing hunters who help nature stay in balance and that lots of owls living in an area can be a sign that the habitat is healthy. On the way, they find out all about how owls' amazing hearing and eyesight can help them hunt and spot an owl out looking for its prey!

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: A mysterious giant bunny delays the nighttime picnic.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: A dancing bug lands on Duggee's head, and he can't stop dancing. The Squirrels take a close look and see that it's a tiny hillbilly bug with a fiddle. What's more, he's got a whole band with him - the Hillbilly Bug Band.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: After Old Brown snatches her, Cotton-tail gets stuck up a tree. It's up to Peter, Lily and Benjamin to rescue her before either a passing Mr Tod seizes her or the angry Owl returns.

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Newfoundland Sylvie is a therapy dog with big soft cuddles who loves to help people when they're worried. She and her owner Katrina visit all sorts of people every day, young and old. It's Sylvie and Katrina's day off, and they're planning a special lunch at the park café. At the bus stop, they meet Dawn from the toy shop, who is worried that her bus is running late. But seeing Sylvie waiting calmly inspires Dawn to do the same.

programme.title: Ranger Hamza's Eco Quest
programme.desc: Ranger Hamza and the Ramblers learn why wildlife corridors are important for the environment. They explore a public garden to search for wildlife corridors and learn why they can make a difference to lots of different creatures.

programme.title: The Game Catchers
programme.desc: The Catchers land on a planet where the inhabitants all look like soap bars, who like to play tug-of-war with water sponges.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: The Heelers play Bus with Dad as the driver, Mum as a passenger, and Bluey and Bingo as the Grannies. When passenger Mum gets too scared to tell bus driver Dad that she secretly loves him, she gets some help from the Grannies.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Dad tries to teach Bluey how to play chess, but Mum thinks she is still too young. When Bingo joins in, the kids make up their own rules, but they still can't beat Dad.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato shows the Grape Kids a Supertato training film, but Evil Pea sneaks in to take over Tato Tower. The Grape Kids use the rug launcher to eject Evil Pea out of the tower.

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Grim HQ struggles through the sky above the Atlantic Ocean, fighting against the powerful winds of a hurricane. One Grimbot falls overboard before the ship crash-lands at Go Jet Academy. Needing another ship to rescue the missing Grimbot, Grandmaster Glitch steals Jetpad. The Go Jetters give chase in the Grimbler, heading right into the eye of the storm.

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: It's Christmas Eve, and Molly and her friends are writing their letters to Santa.

programme.title: Mr Bear's Christmas
programme.desc: Set in the corner of the forest, Mr Bear and his best friend Mouse share their joy of Christmas as they plan a party for all their friends with plenty of festive treats. While getting ready for the party, Mouse ventures out into the forest to find some berries, only to get caught in a snow storm. Despite his best efforts, Mr Bear can't find Mouse and becomes increasingly worried for her as time passes by.

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo, Gran Gran and Panda are helping Cynthia in her garden. Cynthia gives JoJo a present of some sunflower seeds which she can keep ready to plant and grow next year. When she gets home, JoJo decides it would be nice to give Cynthia a surprise.

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: Colly Wobble finds an upside-down crown in the curiosity box, and decides to play being the Upside-Down Princess. In Storyland, everybody visits the extraordinary Upside-Down Castle for a comical Upside-Down tea with the Upside-Down Princess.

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Three pale things - a shell, a spiral and a cone - drift towards the planet seeking music, heat and light to revive them. Tiny and Small have seen them before and know just what to do. Will they be able to revive the new pale star-shaped thing?

programme.title: In the Night Garden
programme.desc: Igglepiggle, Upsy Daisy, Makka Pakka and the teeny tiny Pontipines all get on board. The Tombliboos decide to ride in the Pinky Ponk instead. The Pinky Ponk ponks into a tree and then it ponks into the Gazebo.

programme.title: Cbeebies Bedtime Stories
programme.desc: Idina Menzel tells the story of a little robin who notices the seasons changing.

programme.title: This Is CBeebies
programme.desc: Welcome to the CBeebies channel. Programmes start at 6.00am.

programme.title: This Is CBeebies
programme.desc: Welcome to the CBeebies channel. Programmes start at 6.00am.

programme.desc: The pressure's on to find two new homes for Tim and Lili Maher who plan to spend most of the year on the northern Costa Blanca but also want to return to Great Yarmouth during summer.

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: We catch up with a couple running a boat charter company in Mallorca as they try to boost their income. And two gîte owners in France move on to pastures new.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Max restores a pair of iconic designer chairs, while Henry restores a decrepit garden table into a colourful and valuable new one.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find, fix and flog unwanted possessions. At the fairground, the boys pick up a bicycle made for two, a ship's search lamp and a lambing chair.

programme.title: Car S.O.S
programme.desc: Tim and Fuzz travel to Scotland to take on a 1968 Lancia Fulvia - a 1960s Italian automotive masterpiece. The car belongs to former hairdresser Bill who bought the car back in 1984. It was his pride and joy until it went off the road a few years ago.

programme.title: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie and Phil help more owners decide whether to love their home or sell it. In East Grinstead, Lucy and Lynton are at loggerheads over their three-bed semi.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four sets of B&B owners across Britain compete to see which one provides the best value for money. Robertsbrooke Guesthouse in Swanage is run by Claire Hilton, who feels she has got more than a sporting chance in the competition. However, her first guests Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome are dubious about the cleanliness of their bedroom. Ziggy leaves no stone unturned in his search for dust.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Quirky couple Lynn Self and Ziggy Broome hope to impress with their two-star paradise Eden Lodge in Falmouth, Cornwall. However, with two of the guests - Charlotte Church's parents James and Maria Church - already saying that they wouldn't stay anywhere below a four star, it could be an interesting day. From the offset the guests are wildly unimpressed by their surroundings, from peeling wallpaper to a dirty toilet brush.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dexby Townhouse in Cardiff is in run by Charlotte Church's parents, James and Maria. The hosts lay on a day of white-water rafting in tight wetsuits and some magic tricks courtesy of Maria's young nephew Elliot. However, the next morning some of the guests are kept waiting for their breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: It is the last stay of the competition and the turn of newlyweds Pip Easby and Nicky Lesser-Easby, who run Muddifords Court Country House in Devon. The Churches find their historical four-poster bed a bit small, while not all of the guests enjoy the trip to a local glass-blowing factory. Over dinner some of the participants say what they think of each other, and during the night James gets cold feet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The group meet one last time to find out exactly how much they have been paid by their fellow hoteliers, and to air their grievances face to face. Claire suspects a disappointing payment from James and Maria Church, but an underpayment from a surprising source soon changes the group dynamics. As the final hosts Pip and Nicky prepare to open their envelope, it is still anyone's guess as to who will take the title.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: As winter descends, farmers and their milk are stranded by the snow. A sheep gets stuck in the mud and a slate mine becomes an impromtu ski resort as friends and family enjoy the alpine conditions and spectacular landscape.

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau
programme.desc: Angel creates a series of rooms bursting with beauty in the chateau's pepper-pot turret. Dick opens up a parkour fitness trail in the grounds, but he hits an unexpected snag.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Paul and Amy Wilkinson build a lakeside home in Lincolnshire with five circular timber buildings linked by walkways, but Paul's health suffers as he struggles to finish the build a year.

programme.title: Astrid: Murder in Paris

programme.title: The Larkins
programme.desc: The Major's told that he'll be kicked out unless he pays the rent he owes, Ada insists on providing a home for Alf's teenage tearaway nephew and Hetty offers her notice as soon as the boy walks through the back door.

programme.title: The Resurrection of Zachary Wheeler
programme.desc: A reporter's search for a missing politician brings him to a remote clinic where human zombies are used as organ donors.

programme.title: What's on TPTV with Noel
programme.desc: The founder of Talking Pictures TV and one half of the `Footage Detectives', Noel Cronin, shares shows and films that are seasonally appropriate and answers viewer's questions and queries.

programme.title: Law of the Plainsman
programme.desc: Amos Cameron demands the marshal form a posse when rustlers kill his ranch foreman and steal two prize stallions.

programme.title: Girdle of Gold
programme.desc: A man hides a fortune in his wife's girdle, only to embark on a mad search for the corset when the wife gives it away.

programme.title: Carry on Spying
programme.desc: The dastardly organisation STENCH (Society for the Total Extinction of Non-Conforming Humans) is in possession of the secret Formula X, and its clear that the British secret service must do something. Unfortunately, their sole available resource is Agent Desmond Simpkins and his bumbling trainees Crump, Bind and Honeybutt. The only thing that stands between them and success is their incompetence.

programme.title: Beat the Devil
programme.desc: International swindlers are diverted from their sinister dealings when an explosion wrecks the ship they are aboard.

programme.title: The London Scene
programme.desc: Made as a promotional film to entice tourists to all London had to offer in the 50s. Including Battersea Pleasure Gardens and BBC Centre. Originally on 9.5mm from the Wallace Heaton ltd.

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: Following a series of courtroom dramas, each case taking up three instalments. At the end of each case, a jury of `ordinary' people come together with a verdict regarding the evidence presented.

programme.title: Melvyn's Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Melvyn Hayes returns with more fabulous films from the great decade that is the 1930s. We begin with the 1937 historical drama Victoria the Great, starring Anna Neagle as Queen Victoria.

programme.title: Victoria the Great
programme.desc: The English queen reigns, with the prince consort Albert, from 1837 to her diamond jubilee.

programme.title: Melvyn's Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Melvyn Hayes is an English actor, voice over performer and overall film enthusiast. Hayes introduces a selection of some of the best, and yet somehow under-screened films from the 1930s.

programme.title: Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A prisoner escapes shortly after he receives Christmas pudding.

programme.title: Radio Days
programme.desc: A series of vignettes show the influence of various radio personalities on an average working class New York family during the golden age of radio, in the 1930s and 1940s.

programme.title: Danger UXB
programme.desc: Doctor Gillespie is a boffin working on a new device to combat a lethal new German booby trap. Brian Ash and his section become the reluctant guinea pigs of this experiment.

programme.title: Rumpole of the Bailey
programme.desc: Justice Featherstone gets into hot water with feminists when Rumpole takes on a domestic violence case.

programme.title: The Innocent
programme.desc: Based on Ian McEwan's novel about a naíve British engineer sent to Berlin in 1955 to take part in an espionage mission.

programme.title: The Girl Who Couldn't Quite
programme.desc: Ruth hasn't smiled since she was a little girl but with the friendship of a tramp she smiles again.

programme.title: The Main Chance
programme.desc: David is forced to review his own attitudes to his work and his clients- and also Sarah's.

programme.title: Finders Keepers
programme.desc: A famous singer and his band arrive in a small Spanish town for a concert when a US plane accidentally drops a mini-bomb on it. They then look for the bomb to return it.

programme.title: The Balloon Goes Up
programme.desc: Comedy duo Ethel Revnell and Gracie West masquerade as WAAFs on a balloon site to help the authorities capture a group of fifth columnists.

programme.title: Forces' Sweetheart
programme.desc: Three goofy soldiers vie for the affections of the lovely Judy.

programme.title: Bait
programme.desc: A California gold miner tries to catch his wife with his partner, so he can shoot the latter and take his share.

programme.title: Keep It Clean
programme.desc: Comic misadventures beset an advertising agent attempting to market a relative's new cleaning machine.

programme.title: Only Two Can Play
programme.desc: With an unsatisfying home life and career, librarian John Lewis a humble, married Welsh librarian attempts to have an affair with a local bigwig's wife.

programme.title: Faces in the Dark
programme.desc: A businessman loses his sight in an explosion on the day his wife planned to leave him for another man.

programme.title: Crown Court
programme.desc: Following a series of courtroom dramas, each case taking up three instalments. At the end of each case, a jury of `ordinary' people come together with a verdict regarding the evidence presented.

programme.title: In Suspicious Circumstances
programme.desc: The study of a serial bigamist who stood accused of murder and two friends whose quarrelling ended in death.

programme.title: Look at Life
programme.desc: A fascinating look at canals and how they have been rediscovered by holidaymakers.

programme.title: The Boy and the Pirates
programme.desc: On the beach near his home, Jimmy finds a bottle that contains a genie named Abu, who magically transports him to the ship of the pirate Blackbeard. Abu explains that the bottle must be returned to its original location in three days.

programme.title: Worzel Gummidge
programme.desc: Worzel takes the afternoon off to go to the village fête to see his intended Aunt Sally, even though the ladylike wooden figure considers associating with a scarecrow to be beneath her station.

programme.title: At the Earth's Core
programme.desc: A scientific expedition burrows into the earth and reaches an underworld society at the earth's core which is menaced by flying monsters. A crew member falls in love with a human slave girl held captive by the monsters, and must make a decision to escape alone or remain with her.

programme.title: Lost Hearts
programme.desc: Orphaned Stephen goes to live with his uncle Abney and finds himself haunted by the ghosts of two children. Based on the story by MR James.

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Join Caroline Munro for an evening of horrifying science fiction delights. First up, is the 1985 sci-fi horror Lifeforce featuring British theatrical greats Frank Finlay and Patrick Stewart.

programme.title: Lifeforce
programme.desc: Space vampires spread disease and destruction throughout London after an exploratory mission brings them to Earth.

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: Our next offering, another brilliant sci-fi horror, is The Man Who Turned to Stone. Caroline Munro presents the strange and frightening 1957 film starring Victor Jory.

programme.title: The Man Who Turned to Stone
programme.desc: 18th century scientists, who have discovered the secret to immortality, take over a girl's reformatory.

programme.title: Cellar Club with Caroline Munro
programme.desc: As Caroline Munro prepares to close the doors of The Cellar Club, she provides a glimpse of two more unmissable films coming next week.

programme.title: Harriet Craig
programme.desc: Harriet Craig keeps her family, including husband Walter, cousin Clare Raymond and grandmother Lottie, and the timorous servants firmly under her thumb. programme.title: Doctor Thorne
programme.desc: When Doctor Thorne's penniless niece Mary is excluded from the wedding preparations of her childhood playmate, she probes her uncle about the circumstances of her birth. She is devastated to learn that she is the illegitimate child of his late brother, and it seems she has neither breeding nor fortune. This is a problem as Mary and Frank - heir to the local Greshamsbury estate - have fallen in love.

programme.title: Doctor Thorne
programme.desc: It is election day, and while Sir Roger Scatcherd wins the respect of the voters, he succumbs to ill health at the hustings. Doctor Thorne does his best to ease the pain of the cantankerous old man, but he senses the end is near. Scatcherd's son Louis is called for and he takes an immediate shine to Mary, but Doctor Thorne is horrified to learn that Louis has romantic designs on his niece.

programme.title: Doctor Thorne
programme.desc: While Frank and Mary plan their upcoming nuptials, Lady Arabella determines not to give up without a fight. She manages to persuade Mary that marrying Frank would be a selfish act, and that if she truly loves him she should set him free. Meanwhile, Louis is drinking as much as his father ever did, while struggling with his unpopular position in society and Mary's rejection. A troubled and destructive young man, he takes great pleasure in insulting the Greshams when they invite him for dinner.

programme.title: Battle of Britain
programme.desc: Covering the iconic battle of World War Two that turned the tide of the war and made the D Day landings possible.
